categoryData.displaySubtitle: I haven't received my card, update my delivery address...

answer.answer:
You can change what kind of notifications you get from us in your Settings screen.

To get to your Settings screen, follow these steps:

- Go to "Account" in your Monzo app
- Tap your name at the top of the screen
- Press "Settings"

Toggle off 'Transactions and payments' to stop getting notifications each time thereâ€™s a transaction on your account. 

If you want to stop getting any notifications from Monzo entirely, youâ€™ll need to go into your phoneâ€™s settings and switch them off.

helpArticles.question: Reporting a bug in the app

answer.answer:
Please give us your feedback and bug reports on the Community forum. Feedback is great and helps us improve!

You can reach our Community Forum by tapping the link [here](https://community.monzo.com/c/bugs "Link to Monzo Community Forum").

To add an extra layer of security, you can turn on Fingerprint ID to unlock your Monzo app.

1. Go to the "Account" screen
2. Press your name at the top of the screen
3. Tap "Settings"
2. Youâ€™ll see an option to toggle â€˜Use Fingerprint to unlock appâ€™.

You can also turn on Fingerprint ID to authorise payments. Youâ€™ll find that option in your Settings, too ðŸ˜Š

To log out of your account, follow these steps:


1. Head over to your "Account" screen
2. Tap your name at the top of the screen
3. Press "Profile"
4. Scroll down to the bottom of the screen and tap "Log Out"

There are a few different ways to add your Monzo card to Apple Pay ðŸ’³

- __iPhone__: open the Wallet app and tap the __+__ button
- __Apple Watch__: open the Apple Watch app on your iPhone and tap __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then tap __Add Credit or Debit Card__
- __iPad__: open the Settings app, tap __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then tap __Add Credit or Debit Card__
- __MacBook with Touch ID__: open System Preferences, select __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then click the __Add Card...__ button

If you've just opened your account and didn't set up Apple Pay during signup, you'll need to wait for your card to arrive before you can do it.

You can add your Monzo card to Google Pay if youâ€™ve got a compatible Android phone.

1. Download the Google Pay app from the Google Play Store.
2. Follow the Google Pay appâ€™s instructions to add your Monzo card.
3. Theyâ€™ll send you a code via text to check your account, which youâ€™ll need to enter.

Thatâ€™s it! Youâ€™re ready to go.

helpArticles.question: How do I make my Monzo my default card on Apple Pay?

answer.answer: To make your Monzo card the default card used for Apple Pay transactions just open Wallet on your iPhone, touch and hold your Monzo card and then drag it to the front of your cards ðŸ’³

helpArticles.question: Removing my Monzo card from my Apple Wallet

answer.answer:
To remove your Monzo card from your Apple Wallet, please follow the steps below:

iPhone and iPad : Go to Settings > Wallet & Apple Pay, tap the card that you want to remove, then tap Remove Card.

Apple Watch: Open the Watch app on your iPhone, go to the My Watch tab, scroll down, tap Wallet & Apple Pay, tap the card, then tap Remove Card.

Mac: Go to System Preferences > Wallet & Apple Pay, click the card that you want to remove, then click the minus (â€“) sign to remove the card.

helpArticles.question: Does my device support Apple Pay?

answer.answer: If you have an iPhone 6 or newer then Apple Pay is supported on your device.

helpArticles.question: How to stop duplicate Apple Pay notifications

answer.answer:
Apple send notifications from the Wallet app when you use your card, but these means you'll get two notifications - one from us, and one from Apple. 

You can turn off Apple's notifications from the Wallet app ðŸ˜Š

Follow these steps:

1. Open Wallet
2. Tap your card
3. Tap the little "..." in the bottom right corner
4. Press "Transactions"
5. Toggle "Notifications" off
There isn't a limit for Apple Pay transactions, but some merchants might apply the contactless limit and will only accept payments of up to Â£30

helpArticles.question: How much can I spend using Google Pay?

answer.answer: There is no limit on Google Pay transactions, but some merchants might apply the contactless limit and will only accept payments of up to Â£30. Transactions made in-app are not limited.

helpArticles.question: Can I still use Google Pay if I freeze my Monzo card?

answer.answer: No, when you freeze your Monzo card it prevents any payments from being made using your card.

helpArticles.question: How do I make my Monzo card the default card?

answer.answer: Open your Google Pay app and drag your hot coral Monzo card to the front of your wallet.

Flux allows you to see receipts for purchases, and we've partnered with them so you can see receipts right in the Monzo app

Once youâ€™ve switched it on, any time you shop at one of their supported merchants (Eat, KFC, Itsu, Schuh, Pod, Pure) youâ€™ll be able to see what you bought by heading into that transactionâ€™s page.

You should see the option to switch it on underneath a recent transaction from one of those merchants. Just make sure youâ€™re on the most recent version of the app! ðŸ˜Š

Monzo will share some basic payment data so Flux can match payments with receipt and loyalty information from merchants. 

We'll send the merchant name, payment amount, time, store location, and the last 4 digits of your card number to Flux for this to happen. Flux will only see this data for transactions with a Flux retailer.

We'll also share your email address with Flux when you connect, so if you write to them for customer support they'll be able to match it to your Monzo account for troubleshooting.

helpArticles.question: Turning on Flux so you can see your receipts

answer.answer:
You should see the option to switch Flux on underneath a recent transaction from any of Flux's supported merchants, at the moment these are:

- EAT
- KFC
- Itsu
- Pod
- Pure
- Schuh

Otherwise, if you're on your phone and you have Monzo installed, you can switch it on using the link [here](monzo://partner/connect?name=flux "Switch on Flux"). Make sure youâ€™re on the most recent version of the app though! ðŸ˜Š
